People usually don't understand what's racism. 
It's pretty simple: 
you DO something HATEFUL to a person ONLY BECAUSE the PERSON SKIN COLOR.

It doesnt matter if you are black or white.

But if you DIDN'T DO anything, you have ALL the right in the world to say that you
are not a racist in the face of who is accusing you. DON'T BE SHY.

If you see any leftist politician raisin a flag against racism, give him a punch in the face, because
he is an HIPOCRITE and don't represent black people.

How to not be a racist? EDU-FUCKING-CATION.

Yeah man, rock and roll. But don't be another hipocrite in the world.

I just mind my own business and then all of a sudden this black guy points to me and out rite says "your a racist" i looked at him like um ok why? This other black guy started to chime in saying yeah he is. I looked at him, said. Im not a racist, what makes you say that? he replied "your white, so your automatically a racist and started laughing" see my problem with this is that in America this can lead to serious problems for me. And its next to impossible to speak against is because they will just turn it around and use it to prove that i am one... I fear that if something is not done about this, then it will lead to a nasty future where the whites are not persecuted, and ultimately discriminated against... some people are just crazy, ignorance is the best thing to do.

1565358798_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
ZeroNet does not aim ANONYMITY, they aim an p2p network that naturally can't be censored/removed.
You mixed up Decentralization with Anonymity.

They are not always together, for example: gab is a decentralized network and can have many instances.
That's an example of decentralization, no one can stop their network.

But you can't have privacy by sharing identities between instances.
The only way to do this is giving a fake identity, like using Tor.

I think the solution to decentralization here is running multiple instances that can share the same network.
This way the network won't 'die' ever.

1565456974_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXq.body:
To Sticky a topic you must change in content.json file.
You'll find in the admin sector:
"..." : {
  "admin": ....
  "sticky": ["....","...."],
}

Then sign and publish.
